page.title: 04SLOUGH
page.content: Royal travellers from Windsor castle going north to join the early east -west tracks or travelling further north to the Norman castle of Berkhamstead had to cross the marshy flood plains of the Thames.At the junction of these tracks Slough(a miry place)was born . Slough remained a small town providing services for travellers until the advent of the railway in Slough,positioned here rather than Windsor at the insistence of the Provost of Eton college who feared the boys might escape by train! Further growth came in the 1920's with the birth of the trading estate which is the source of most of Slough's present wealth.
